definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster

sentences.english: I can't permit you to temporize any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我不能允許你再拖延時間了。

sentences.english: So the king ordered that the marriage of the shepherd and the princess take place without delay.
sentences.chinese: 於是王下令，該牧羊人和公主的婚姻採取不拖延。

sentences.english: Every postponement reduces the effectiveness of your work with SuperMemo.
sentences.chinese: 每次拖延都可能降低學習的效率。

sentences.english: The Procrastinator is always about to start something.
sentences.chinese: 拖延的人總是打算做一些事。

sentences.english: People often use several well-known excuses to procrastinate.
sentences.chinese: 人們經常用一些人所共知的藉口去拖延時間。

sentences.english: Procrastination is spending 30 mins looking for the right pen.
sentences.chinese: 拖延症是花30分鐘去找一支對的筆。

sentences.english: Delays or outright refusals have been reported for imports permits for alumina (feeder stock for aluminum) .
sentences.chinese: 據報道，進口氧化鋁的許可被拖延或者直接否決。

sentences.english: And the longer we delay, the more unpleasant the adaptations and the greater the suffering will be.
sentences.chinese: 我們越是拖延，將更難以適應並且苦難將更深重。

sentences.english: Procrastination is spending 30 minutes looking for the right pen.
sentences.chinese: 拖延症是花30分鐘去找一支對的筆。

sentences.english: Understanding can wait, but obedience can't.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以慢慢了解真相，卻不能拖延抗命。

sentences.english: All procrastinators put off things they have to do.
sentences.chinese: 拖延者都把他們需做之事推遲。

sentences.english: Eagerly pursue mission liberating hangups truly.
sentences.chinese: 熱心地追求真正解放拖延的任務。

sentences.english: Procrastination can be beat, it just takes some self-awareness and effort.
sentences.chinese: 拖延能被打敗，只是需要一些自我意識和努力。

sentences.english: I’ve never in my life seen a happy procrastinator.
sentences.chinese: 在我的生活裏我從來都沒見過一個快樂的拖延者。

sentences.english: His advice determined me to delay no more.
sentences.chinese: 他的勸告使我決定不再拖延。

sentences.english: Doing something every day short-circuits procrastination and self-doubt.
sentences.chinese: 每天都做一些事，可以終止拖延症和自我懷疑。

definition: to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
